name: The Pledge Drive Quiz | 'Seinfeld' - Season 6 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the name of the magazine that Kramer asks about in the beginning of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Fortune.

	In the beginning of the episode, Jerry and Elaine are talking about Elaine's friend, Noreen, and how she was flirting with Jerry.  Elaine says that it's weird since she has a boyfriend already.  Then Kramer comes in and checks Jerry's mail for his Fortune magazine.  While rooting through the mail, he finds a greeting card for Jerry, and it turns out to be from a woman at PBS who is thanking Jerry for appearing on the pledge drive which is about to happen.

questions.text: What is the name of Noreen's boyfriend?
questions.explanation:
Dan.

	When Elaine calls Noreen to ask if she likes Jerry, she talks to Dan.  Elaine ends up asking Dan if he likes Jerry because Dan is a high-talker and she can't tell that it isn't Noreen.  Later, Noreen calls Elaine at Mr. Pitt's office and they argue over the phone.

questions.text: What chocolate bar does Mr. Pitt eat with a knife and a fork?
questions.explanation:
Snickers & Snicker.

	After talking to Noreen at Mr. Pitt's office, Mr. Pitt starts eating a Snickers bar with a knife and a fork.  Of course, Elaine finds this unusual.  Throughout the episode, more and more people start eating weird foods with utensils, and in the end, Elaine yells at the people at Monk's for eating weirdly.

	When Kristin goes to Jerry's apartment to talk about the pledge drive, she asks about the card that she sent him and she finds it in the garbage.  She decides to leave and she tells Jerry that he has no sentimentality, so Jerry shows her some old birthday cards he had from his grandmother.

questions.text: How much money does Jerry's grandmother give him for his birthday every year?
questions.explanation:
$10.

	When Kramer finds cheques in Jerry's cards, he asks why Jerry never cashes them, and Jerry says that it's just ten dollars.  Kramer persuades Jerry to cash them and it gets him into a lot of trouble.  Later, when Jerry and George are having lunch, Jerry asks George if one of the Yankees would like to be in the pledge drive with him, and George decides to check it out.

questions.text: Which Yankee did George get to appear on the fundraiser?
questions.explanation:
Danny Tartabull.

	At a meeting with the Yankees executives, George brought up the PBS idea, and although they didn't like it at first, they agreed to it after George started eating a Snickers bar with a knife and a fork.  Meanwhile, Jerry's grandmother tried to get to her old branch of the Chemical Bank in order to fix up the account problems caused by Jerry's cheques.

questions.text: Who tells Jerry that his Nana is missing?
questions.explanation:
Uncle Leo.

	After cashing the cheques, Uncle Leo tells Jerry that his Nana is missing and that she hasn't left the apartment in more than twenty years.  Jerry admits to have cashed in his Nana's cheques and Uncle Leo says that her Chemical Bank branch closed a while ago.  When Jerry tells Kramer, Kramer blames his Nana.

questions.text: What does Noreen end up eating with a knife and a fork?
questions.explanation:
A cookie.

	While at Monk's, Elaine tells Noreen that Dan is a high-talker, and because of this, she thought that she was talking to Noreen the whole time.  Noreen then proceeds to eat a cookie with utensils because she saw George's boss eating a Snickers with a knife and a fork.  Elaine finds it weird that the news is already spreading about the utensils.

questions.text: Kramer told Jerry's Nana to drop dead.
questions.explanation:
False.

	While at Jerry's, Elaine picks up the phone and assumes that Nana is Dan, so she tells her to drop dead.  Soon, they realize that it was Nana calling (at the Chemical Bank) and Jerry can't help her because he has the fundraiser.  Meanwhile, George pursues a man who he thinks gave him the middle finger while driving Danny Tartabull to the PBS pledge drive.

questions.text: How much does Jerry's Nana donate to PBS?
questions.explanation:
$1,500.

	While Jerry is at the fundraiser, his Nana calls to try and tell him that she needs to write new cheques.  She ends up talking to Kramer and he announces that Nana just donated $1,500.  Uncle Leo ends up coming out and ruining everything because Nana is on a very fixed income.  George and Danny Tartabull don't make it to the pledge drive because George chases the man who gave him the finger about a mile out of Manhattan only to realize that the man's hand was in a cast, and it wasn't his fault. In the end, Jerry and Elaine are at Monk's and everyone is eating weird things with their utensils.  Jerry even saw one person eating M&Ms with a spoon.
